image.altText: A rainbow on a beach

props.synopsis: The West Australian government says its planned new marine park will be world-class. But among locals, opinion is split on whether it will deliver a promised tourism windfall.

title.children: This new marine park has been compared to the Great Barrier Reef and Ningaloo. But will it bring tourists?

image.altText: Composite image of surfers at the paddle out and Aaron Beveridge.

props.synopsis: South West WA's surfing community joined Aaron Beveridge's family and friends at Surfer's Point to honour his unique life after he went missing off the surf break a week ago.

title.children: Surfers unite for paddle-out tribute for mate believed drowned off WA's Prevelly

image.altText: Leo Puglisi fronting a 6 News bulletin when he was 12.

props.synopsis: Sixteen-year-old Leonardo Puglisi started his online news channel 6 News when he was just 11 years old. He's horrified at the federal bipartisan support in banning social media for children under the age of 16.

title.children: Teen news anchor says popular news service would've never started under kids' social media ban

image.altText: A construction bobcat transferring tree debris to a woodchipper hitched to the back of a truck.

props.synopsis: The combined damage bill from two severe storms that struck Western Australia's largest regional city is yet to be fully finalised, with the clean-up expected to stretch well into July.

title.children: Damage bill from Bunbury's tornado, freak storm still to be finalised as clean-up continues

image.altText: Shayna Jack and Mollie O'Callaghan react in the pool after a race

props.synopsis: A defiant Mollie O'Callaghan and an overjoyed Shayna Jack book their spots in a dramatic 100m freestyle final at the Australian Swimming Trials.

title.children: O'Callaghan, Jack claim coveted individual spots in 100 metre freestyle, fresh faces feature in Paralympic team

image.altText: A woman walks towards a dry river bed.

props.synopsis: Bridging the gap between scientific monitoring and cultural knowledge, traditional owners say persistent pools along the Gascoyne River are changing with dire consequences.

title.children: 'Rainmaker' sounds the alarm as Western Australia's longest river runs dry

image.altText: Sophia Huang Xueqin

props.synopsis: Human rights groups call for the immediate release of journalist Sophia Huang Xueqin and labour activist Wang Jianbing, saying they've been imprisoned for exercising their right to free speech.

title.children: 'Malicious and groundless': Leading Chinese #MeToo journalist jailed in China for inciting subversion

image.altText: A man stands posing for a photo on a wooden walkway in front of trees, wearing a white shirt and dark pants.

props.synopsis: A 37-year-old Perth man charged with the manslaughter of his partner's 11-year-old son after allegedly neglecting him a decade earlier will remain behind bars until later this month.

title.children: Man faces court charged with boy's manslaughter after allegedly leaving him severely disabled as a baby

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of Greg Lynn

props.synopsis: Deliberations in the murder trial of Greg Lynn, accused of killing two Victorian campers, will begin next week.

title.children: 'One narrow path to unanimous' guilty verdicts in Greg Lynn trial, jurors told

image.altText: A woman with blond hair in pink shirt and blazer

props.synopsis: The federal seat of North Sydney is set to be scrapped under new draft boundaries proposed by the Australian Electoral Commission.

title.children: 'I don't know': Tink undecided if she'll challenge a neighbouring teal with North Sydney facing axe

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFL player grins with his tongue out as he celebrates during a game.

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions withstand a brilliant final term from St Kilda to grab four vital premiership points at the Gabba. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Lions grab vital win over the Saints to keep in touch with the top eight

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Vital next five weeks for Lions
FT: Brisbane Lions beat St Kilda by 20 points
Has Joe Daniher kicked the sealer for Brisbane?

image.altText: Cate Campbell leaving the blocks at the Australian Olympic swimming trials.

props.synopsis: In one of the highest-quality 100m freestyle fields in Australian swimming history, four-time Olympic gold medallist Cate Campbell misses out on making the final by just 0.01 seconds.

title.children: The agonising margin that sees world record holder Cate Campbell miss out on the race of the championships

image.altText: A woman holds a sign saying minister watt TF

props.synopsis: WA farmers impacted by the proposed ban have had their say in Northam today, after a Canberra hearing heard from animal activists and industry leaders earlier this week.

title.children: Farmers 'frustrated beyond words' over live sheep export debate as inquiry hears emotional testimony

image.altText: A hand wearing a blue rubber glove holding a small tin full of pouches.

props.synopsis: Nicotine pouches are illegal in Australia, but they've been seized in alarming quantities since the federal government's ban on single-use vapes. Here's why the small sachets have authorities worried.

title.children: Are nicotine pouches the next vape? Authorities warn Australia is being flooded with them

image.altText: White airliner aircraft with red tail against blue sky

props.synopsis: Travel is a hot-button issue in the AFL this season, with both WA sides doing what they can to mitigate the burden. Now a researcher, embedded with Super Rugby side the Western Force, explains just how draining the flights can be.

title.children: Some have said the travel factor for WA sporting teams is overstated. This researcher says otherwise

image.altText: Supreme Court justices sitting and standing in black robes in official portrait.

props.synopsis: For the first time since his supporters stormed the Capitol on January 6, Donald Trump returned to meet Republican politicians. The Supreme Court had just given them something to talk about.

title.children: America's Supreme Court just took some heat out of a fight that could have been hard for Trump to win

image.altText: Illuminated purple and white Telstra Shop signage outside Brisbane CBD store.

props.synopsis: Two South Australian Aboriginal health clinics have temporarily closed due to a nationwide Telstra data outage, which has also left three regional councils unable to perform critical services.

title.children: Telstra outage forces Aboriginal health clinics to temporarily shut, disrupts regional councils

image.altText: A photo of Keith Kerinauia being escorted by a prison security guard at the BWS Airport Tavern bottleshop.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering 20-year-old bottle shop worker Declan Laverty at a Darwin BWS returned to be bottle shop for the first time since the fatal stabbing  alongside the judge and jury of his his murder trial.

title.children: Jury, murder accused taken to scene of fatal Darwin bottle shop stabbing

image.altText: A man viewed through a partially open door.

props.synopsis: State and territory hospital funding negotiations are on pause according to the federal health minister in an effort to focus on the overhaul of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), despite public hospitals being under pressure.

title.children: States and territories receive hospital funding negotiation pause to 'catch up' on NDIS reform

image.altText: A person with a shaved head and in a hooded top.

props.synopsis: The case against 22-year-old Dylan Lloyd, who sexually assaulted a girl on a train in Adelaide's south, will be escalated to the state's highest court.

title.children: Man who raped 12yo girl on Adelaide train can't or won't control sexual instincts, prosecutors argue

image.altText: Ashton Jones looks at the camera and has a large yellow and blue parrot on his back

props.synopsis: Hobart man Caleb Adams will serve a prison sentence for manslaughter. The court has heard Adams was 'justifiably scared' when 34 year old Ashton Jones invaded his home, but that he had responded disproportionately to the event.

title.children: Ashton Jones died while attempting to break into his neighbour's home, his killer has been sentenced

image.altText: kevin weekes himself

props.synopsis: Kevin Weekes's world shattered when his doctor asked him if his affairs were in order. Five years on, Sibelco has been fined for failing to act on "red flags".

title.children: Global company fined $400k after workers exposed to silica dust

image.altText: The artist Guy Warren, a man in his late 90s with a apron on and arms crossed, sitting in his studio

props.synopsis: The "trailblazing" Australian artist — who won the Archibald in 1985 — had a career spanning more than 80 years and was painting right up until he died.

title.children: 'He was saying he wanted another 50 years to paint': Australian artist Guy Warren dies aged 103

image.altText: Drone shot of Lincoln prison

props.synopsis: The lawyer who represented the family of the last Aboriginal death at Port Lincoln Prison 21 years ago says he is concerned SA jail cells have not been made safe despite multiple recommendations in the past.

title.children: Anger and grief over 'preventable' death in custody of 23yo Aboriginal man despite royal commission

image.altText: black and white photo of punk band the saints standing before a brick wall

props.synopsis: The estate of Chris Bailey has hit out at his former bandmates for a recent reformation. The band's manager says their claims are unwarranted.

title.children: A new version of The Saints has angered the estate of singer Chris Bailey

image.altText: The sign out of the front of the building and the crest, with an autumnal tree nearby and a blue sky beyond.

props.synopsis: A Canberra woman says she felt like a piece of property after a man she met in a nightclub wrote all over her in permanent marker, before raping her twice and threatening to distribute images of her.

title.children: Canberra man who raped woman and wrote on her with permanent marker faces sentencing

image.altText: A man in a grey suit and glasses looks downcast, eyes down, serious woman with sunglasses next to him. Tree in the background.

props.synopsis: Senior constable Tom Harper pleaded guilty to not performing a proper random breath test on someone he knew.

title.children: No conviction for police officer over 'very poor' decision to fake random breath test

image.altText: In Inside Out 2, Riley's emotions face the biggest challenge of them all: Puberty.

props.synopsis: Pixar president Jim Morris confirmed in May that the studio would be focusing more on IP expansion than original storytelling. It shows with Inside Out 2.

title.children: Inside Out 2 is a worrying look into the future of original Pixar storytelling

image.altText: Robbie Katter holds a "condemn Hamas" sign at pro-Palestine protest in front of Queensland Parliament.

props.synopsis: Ethics Committee chair Stirling Hinchliffe told the House that the two north Queensland-based members had engaged in disorderly conduct during the fiery exchange.

title.children: Robbie Katter will need to apologise to parliament after being found in contempt over pro-Palestinian rally

image.altText: TV psychic John Edward sits on a blue couch in a TV studio. He wears a black button-up shirt and is looking off screen.

props.synopsis: TV psychic John Edward has won plenty of fans and critics for his claimed abilities to communicate with the dead. But there's one person he wouldn't talk to, alive or otherwise.

title.children: Famous TV psychic John Edward blasts Donald Trump

image.altText: An elderly woman wearing a red shirt smiling and a dog being held by its owner

props.synopsis: The NSW deputy coroner has recommended an overhaul of punishments for non-compliant dog owners in her findings following an inquest into the death of a 90-year-old Shoalhaven woman.

title.children: Death of 90-year-old volunteer in savage dog attack was preventable, coroner finds

image.altText: A photo of cocaine bags in a black safe with a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: Packages of cocaine and methamphetamine hidden in air cargo have been monitored by crime squad detectives and led to the arrest of three men in the Northern Territory.

title.children: 'This is not over': $7m bust allegedly disrupts large-scale international drug cartel

image.altText: Hollywood actor Henry Winkler in a green jacket with three firefighters in front of a Dublin Fire Brigade truck.

props.synopsis: Irish fire crews who raced to reports of an emergency at a Dublin hotel were surprised to find Happy Days star Henry Winkler among the chaos outside.

title.children: Henry Winkler describes 'amazing adventure' of fire evacuation in Dublin
